description.narrative: The Project would: (i) reduce CO2 emissions by displacing carbon intensive generation in the merit order of dispatch; (ii) deliver electricity output at a competitive tariff; (iii) contribute to improve competitiveness of the sector by supporting one of the first wind IPP projects and catalyzing private sector investments; and (iv) increase resilience of electricity supply by diversifying Uzbekistan energy mix.

The project consists of the development, design, financing, construction, operation and maintenance of the 500MW Zarafshan wind power plant located in the Navoi region of Uzbekistan (the Project) under the terms of a 25-year Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) with the JSC National Electric Grid of Uzbekistan (NEGU), the state-owned single buyer and offtaker.
